channel.title: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR
channel.description:
Well Since VB Is my most recent attempt at scripting. I Would like to know how to make my own scripting program simmiler to scar. (prolly not as many functions) Googled. Many Many times. With every keyword i can think of. No Help :(
Anyone got any tuts? or show me in the right direciton.

item.title: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“Texasmd91, post:18, topic:51260”][quote author=wonderguy6 link=topic=71857.msg822920#msg822920 date=1169796799]

try using this site for vb related things has a library might help good luck ! http://cruelclient.com/cruelsnet/index.php?s=ade399028966739f45a3294b560c20b2&showforum=1

Why go to crules.net when there is 1000+ Members when i can stay here and get the same result/better result with 50k+ Members?
[/quote]
except only about 50 misb members know vb and prob half do over there =p[/quote]
Yeh. But your more likly to get a response than over there cause only around 100members are active.
So thats 50 Members aswell. :o

Everyone stop posting and refer to this post!!!

[quote=“wonderguy6, post:10, topic:51260”][quote author=thiefmn6092 link=topic=71857.msg818252#msg818252 date=1169716736]
Use MSscriptcontrol, Go to Componets and find MSscriptcontrol or someting similiar and drag it into your application, Then go use google and find a documentation on it.
[/quote]
thx so much thiefmn6092!

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


Mod Please Lock Question solved. :D[/quote]

Read full topic

item.source: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR

item.title: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:2, topic:51260”]Just guessing, but if i was to write my own Scripting Program in Scar i’d do something like…

If, like scar, mine began at “begin”:

if(Lowercase(Line1OfMemoOrWhatever) = 'begin') then ScriptStarted:= true;

then for functions: (If the function/procedure was named “mouse” and the parametres x & y)


if (pos('mouse', lowercase(line)) > 0) then
begin
  a:= (pos('mouse', lowercase(line)) > 0) + 1;
  m:= pos(',', copy(line, a, length(line))) > 0;
  x:= copy(line, a, m);
  y:= copy(line, m, length(line)-1);
  MoveMouse(strtoint(x), strtoint(y));
end;

But if i were to do so i’d probably write a function to more easily find the parametres.
I’d also have to write things that would check for errors and such.

Basically by all that i mean that i would check the line for the function/procedure name and then copy what’s inside the brackets (its parametres) and initiate the function.

Mouse(5, 5);

I’d look for “Mouse” then after the bracket to the first comma the first parametre (x) and from the comma to the ending bracket the next (y).

Hope it helped at all?
Good luck.[/quote]
lol. In SCAR?

oh. ok. But if anyone would like to help me further with this i would certainty give credz upon release

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR

item.title: Creating a Scripting Program like SCAR
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Just guessing, but if i was to write my own Scripting Program in Scar i’d do something like…

If, like scar, mine began at “begin”:

if(Lowercase(Line1OfMemoOrWhatever) = 'begin') then ScriptStarted:= true;

then for functions: (If the function/procedure was named “mouse” and the parametres x & y)


if (pos('mouse', lowercase(line)) > 0) then
begin
  a:= (pos('mouse', lowercase(line)) > 0) + 1;
  m:= pos(',', copy(line, a, length(line))) > 0;
  x:= copy(line, a, m);
  y:= copy(line, m, length(line)-1);
  MoveMouse(strtoint(x), strtoint(y));
end;

But if i were to do so i’d probably write a function to more easily find the parametres.
I’d also have to write things that would check for errors and such.

Basically by all that i mean that i would check the line for the function/procedure name and then copy what’s inside the brackets (its parametres) and initiate the function.

Mouse(5, 5);

I’d look for “Mouse” then after the bracket to the first comma the first parametre (x) and from the comma to the ending bracket the next (y).

Hope it helped at all?
Good luck.

Read full topic
